sub_topic: Determining the volume of a cone.
message_1: What is the volume of a cone with a radius of 5 cm and a height of 10 cm? (Round your answer to the nearest tenth.)
message_2:
The formula for the volume of a cone is V = (1/3)πr²h, where V is the volume, r is the radius, and h is the height.

In this case, the radius (r) is 5 cm and the height (h) is 10 cm. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

V = (1/3)π(5²)(10)
V = (1/3)π(25)(10)
V = (1/3)π(250)
V ≈ (1/3)(3.14159)(250)
V ≈ (1.047197)(250)
V ≈ 261.799

So, the volume of the cone is approximately 261.8 cubic centimeters (rounded to the nearest tenth).
